issues.title: feature request. view zip archive contents in browser
issues.body:
title says all

when i request a zip file via
http://127.0.0.1:43110/x/data/users/y/z.zip

i do not always want to download the zip file,
but first want to see its contents,
or at least some metadata,
which needs only little processing

then i can choose to,
either download the zip file,
or browse and view its contents in my webbrowser

example,
in zeroup, search zip, download, open
----> will force to download the zip archive

we could use libarchive 
https://pypi.org/project/libarchive/

supported archive formats
https://github.com/libarchive/libarchive/wiki/LibarchiveFormats

python-libarchive is a wrapper 
from python zipfile and tarfile modules to libarchive

the firefox addon zip-manager,
is not working for me,
plus, it can only download files,
not show them in the webbrowser

alci
